page.title: 10Filey's Edwardian Festival.
page.content: The idea of having a festival to increase the tourist trade of Filey began in 1980 when the church of Saint Oswald had its Octo Centenary. The following year it was decided it should be an Edwardian Festival because the buildings on the front were mainly Edwardian. Local traders and people in Filey dress in Edwardian costumes throughout the week. Several traders attempt to give their shops an Edwardian flavour. There are over ninety events which take place during the week.It begins with a craft market held in the Town Hall gardens. Local school gymnasts, choirs and bands entertain the public. There are art,craft and photographic{ exhibitions and displays by local organisations.Each evening a different band and the Fishermen's choir entertain people in the bandstand.
